conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effects of light source position.
Shadows are currently cast to the left of the objects.
Light source is to the left of the objects.
When light source moves to the right, shadows will shift to the left side of the objects.
Shadow A (Egg) will move to the left of the egg.
Shadow B (Apple) will move to the left of the apple.
Shadow C (Baseball) will move to the left of the baseball.
Shadow D (Microphone) will move to the left of the microphone.
Size of shadows will depend on the angle of the light source.
If light source moves directly above, shadows will become shorter.
If light source moves to the right but not directly above, shadows may not change significantly in size unless angle changes drastically.
All shadows will move to the left side of their respective objects.
Shadows will likely become shorter if light source is directly above.
Final answer: Shadows will shift to the left side of the objects and may become shorter if light source is directly above.
